result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy D. Rohland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CF220 and 16CM136 called together at 9:52am [ma]
Defendant Troy D Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Special Prosecutor, Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court and Counsel discuss the statutory minimum jail time on Case 16CF220

ADA Buker submits Mr. Rohland's DOT driving record as State's Exhibit #1; the Court receives this exhibit

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Case 16CF220; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Buker verifies victim rights compliance

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Case 16CM136

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rohland

On Case 16CF220: the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 6 months  in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for purposes of employment and treatment, to commence FORTHWITH
---Mr.Rohland is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by Agent 
--To pay fine of $600+ costs
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand 
--attendance at Victim Impact Panel 

The Court orders: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period  

-- 6 demerit points 


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:10:
Status conference on September 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

[MK[ cases #16CF220, #16CM136 called at 11:14am. 
Defendant Troy D Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  Special Prosecutor Katharine Buker appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

In Case #16CF220 Mr. Rohland waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

In Case #16CF220 Arraignment is held:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--plea of "not guilty" entered
The Court continues Bond.
Attorney De La Rosa requests that the cases be scheduled for Status in approximately 45 days; the Defense has received a plea-offer from the State and this is being given consideration.
recess 11:17am

NEXT:   Status Conference on 9/29/16 at 9:30am
Status conference on August 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Cases 16CF220 & 16CM136 called together at 9:33 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Troy D Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Special Prosecutor from Rock County Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they need to move forward on amending the OWI and then get together to attempt to resolve matters

Service of the amended complaint admitted; reading waived
Counsel agree an informal pre-trial can be held
Preliminary hearing time limits waived by parties
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that It will likely be waiver of preliminary hearing, but matter can be set for preliminary hearing in approximately 30 days.
Atty Buker agrees, and informs the Court that she is unavailable from August 8 - 29th. Likely can resolve matters at next hearing.
Court reminds Mr. Rohland that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect 
Recess: 9:37 am 

NEXT: (1) 16CF220: Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/4/16 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) 16CM136: Schedule STC 8/4/16 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Cases 16CM136 and 16CT112 called together at 10:54am [mo]
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   Special Prosecutor, Katharine Buker appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court acknowleges receipt of the letter written to the Court and the the subsequent change of hearing time.
The Court suggests that Mr. Rohland make an appointment to meet with Atty. De La Rosa

Atty. Hagemann requests an additional status

Service of Amended Criminal Complaint and waives reading. 

The Court now calls case 16CF220.
The Court maintains the previously established bond
The Court directs that the Clerk prepare a new bond with new case number.

Parties waive preliminary hearing time limits
An informal ptc will be conducted.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess: 11:02am
NEXT: Status Conference on 7/6/16 at 9:30am

The Court will change the time of the hearing but not the date, in order to allow def to attend his assessment. New court date and time is June 10 at 10:45 am RRk cc: all  
P.S. to defendant: Please don't wait until the last minute to try to reschedule
from Defendant requesting court date be rescheduled and and requesting new counsel be appointed
Status conference on June 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #16CM136 and #16CT112 called at 2:36pm. 
Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa in court.  Special Prosecutor Rock County Assistant District Attorney Katharine Buker appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa files Authorizations to Appear in each case.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; the Defense waives speedy trial. 
ADA Buker alerts the Court that once verification of the Dane County OWI 3rd Conviction is received, then she will be filing an Amended Complaint because the current case #16CT112-OWI will become a felony.
The Court instructs ADA Buker that when she files the Amended Complaint, if she has communicated with Attorney De La Rosa about the filing and he has no objection to it, then she should include this in her cover letter so that court staff knows they do not need to schedule a separate hearing regarding leave to file the Amended Complaint.  
The Court continues Bond. 
recess 2:40pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on both cases on June 10th at 9:30am; if the Defendant is still in custody on that date, the Court would allow an authorization to appear or else having the Defendant appear via videoconferencing
Adjourned initial appearance on May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 16CM136 & 16CT112 called together at 8:50 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac J. Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court.  Attorney Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, to cover BOTH CASES, with conditions: 
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid license or permit
- Make all court appearances
- Obey the law
Recess: am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 5/4/16 at 1:30 pm  - Send notices
